page.title: 05 HOUSING
page.content: In general the various houses in the area are well cared for. The old houses in the Town and along the Highway contrast with the Council housing areas of 1930's and 1950's and the private housing estate of a hundred houses built in the 1970's. More recently there has been some infilling of newer houses along the Causeway and Highway. Currently the County Council is undertaking renovation on its older houses, costing several thousand pounds per house. On the Estate replacement windows and cavity insulation have been in vogue in recent years. We found that most people moving to the Estate do so because the houses are reasonably priced in pleasant surroundings....but job mobility here causes a fairly fluid population.
